    Read list of commits

    Reproducible example

    Create a versioned directory with some commits and a NEWS.md

    • Some commits mention an issue with #
    • Some commits mention a ticket with ticket
    • A commit is associated with a tag
    repo <- fake_repo()

    Get commits and find pattern

    • Find all commits of a branch and associate with tags recursively
    get_commits_tags(repo, ref = "master")
#> 4 commits found.
#> # A tibble: 4 x 9
#>   sha   summary message author email when                order tag.name
#>   <chr> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>  <chr> <dttm>              <int> <chr>   
#> 1 1511… Add NE… "Add N… Alice  alic… 2019-09-27 11:54:21     4 <NA>    
#> 2 719d… Third … "Third… Alice  alic… 2019-09-27 11:54:21     3 v0.1    
#> 3 8e3a… exampl… "examp… Alice  alic… 2019-09-27 11:54:21     2 v0.1    
#> 4 9fb8… First … First … Alice  alic… 2019-09-27 11:54:21     1 v0.1    
#> # … with 1 more variable: tag.message <chr>
    • Find all commits of a branch and detect a specific pattern
      • Here we find commits mentionning an issue with #123 
    get_commits_pattern(repo, pattern = "#[[:digit:]]+", ref = "master")
#> 4 commits found.
#> # A tibble: 6 x 10
#>   sha   summary message author email when                order tag.name
#>   <chr> <chr>   <chr>   <chr>  <chr> <dttm>              <int> <chr>   
#> 1 1511… Add NE… "Add N… Alice  alic… 2019-09-27 11:54:21     4 <NA>    
#> 2 1511… Add NE… "Add N… Alice  alic… 2019-09-27 11:54:21     4 <NA>    
#> 3 719d… Third … "Third… Alice  alic… 2019-09-27 11:54:21     3 v0.1    
#> 4 719d… Third … "Third… Alice  alic… 2019-09-27 11:54:21     3 v0.1    
#> 5 8e3a… exampl… "examp… Alice  alic… 2019-09-27 11:54:21     2 v0.1    
#> 6 9fb8… First … First … Alice  alic… 2019-09-27 11:54:21     1 v0.1    
#> # … with 2 more variables: tag.message <chr>, pattern <chr>
